--- title: Supinator Muscle --- ![Left Humerus (Anterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image207 gray1918 Left humerus. Anterior view.gif){#fig-gray1918-image207} ![Muscles that move the Forearm @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.25 Muscles That Move the Forearm.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.25} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Supinator Muscle @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - Neumann @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-supinator-muscle-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Supinator Olecranon
Lateral epicondyle
Radial collateral lig.
Annular lig.		 Radius (between radial tuberosity and pronator teres) Radial n.
C6 - C7		 Radioulnar joints: Supination
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} The *supinator muscle* has a common proximal origin before separating into *deep* and *superficial* layers: @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - Lateral epicondyle of Humerus [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025]. - Ulnar attachment is either the Olecranon of Ulna [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020] or *supinator crest adjacent to the ulnar fossa* [@jonesProjectFoundations2025]. - Radial collateral ligament [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025]. - Annular ligament of radius [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025]. # Insertion {#insertion} The supinator wraps around the proximal 1/3rd of the of the radius and it inserts on the proximal, lateral, posterior radial surface [@jonesProjectFoundations2025]. According to gilroy @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020, the supinator muscle inserts onto the Radius (*between radial tuberosity and insertion of pronator teres*) [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020] # Pathway {#pathway} - Consists of both superficial and deep layers @jonesProjectFoundations2025. - Radial surface of supinator is bordered by: ECRB & ECRL muscles @jonesProjectFoundations2025 - The ulnar side of the supinator is covered by the inferior part of the [anconeus]({{< var ref-anconeus.path >}}) # Innervation {#innervation} [Posterior Interosseous N.]({{< var ref-posterior-interosseous-nerve.path >}}) ([C6]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c6 >}}), [C7]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c7 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} **Forearm**: Supination Synergists: Strong and forceful supnation requires assistance from the Biceps brachii, thus the most powerful supination occurs when the elbow is at 90° flexion to maximize biceps brachii efficiency @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Antagonists - [Pronator quadratus]({{< var ref-pronator-quadratus.path >}}) @jonesProjectFoundations2025 # Notes
